sentence.Network_en: Andy Canvin is a pioneer on the strange frontier of DNA genealogy.
sentence.Network_cn: 安迪-卡文是DNA谱系学奇异前沿的先锋人物.

sentence.Network_en: He had sat and repeated his family's genealogy to her, twenty minutes of nonstop names.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坐下又给她细数了一遍他家族的家谱，20分钟内说出了一连串的名字。

sentence.Network_en: He was proficient in all questions of genealogy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他非常精通所有家谱的问题.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French and late Latin from Greek genealogia, from genea 'race, generation' + -logia (see -logy)

entry.def: Genealogy is the study of the history of families, especially through studying historical documents to discover the relationships between particular people and their families.
A genealogy is the history of a family over several generations, for example describing who each person married and who their children were.

example.ex: He had sat and repeated his family's genealogy to her, twenty minutes of nonstop names.
example.tran: 他坐下又给她细数了一遍他家族的家谱，20分钟内说出了一连串的名字。
